meanings.sent1: My brother and I play together every day.
meanings.sent2: I have one brother and two sisters.
meanings.sent3: My brother always tries to steal my snacks!
meanings.sent4: The bond between brothers is unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: Growing up with a brother is a unique experience.

meanings.definition: A male person who has the same parents as another person.
meanings.sent1: My brother and I have the same mom and dad.
meanings.sent2: She is my brother because we share the same parents.
meanings.sent3: My brother and I argue about who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: He is like a brother to me, even though we are not related.
meanings.sent5: Having a brother means always having a partner in crime.

meanings.definition: A close male friend or associate.
meanings.sent1: Tom is like a brother to me; we've been friends since kindergarten.
meanings.sent2: My brother always has my back no matter what.
meanings.sent3: I told my brother a secret, and he couldn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, a true brother will never let you down.
meanings.sent5: Having a brother means always having someone to share your joys and sorrows with.
